title: I Found Intolerance in Germany, and Not on the Right
summary: The organizer of the conference in Heidelberg reproached me for briefing the main opposition party.. I traveled to Germany in December to present a paper at Heidelberg University. Later I shared other research I had done with legislators, their staff and the media at the Bundestag in Berlin. Both these activities are common for professors, particularly political scientists. This time was different, though, because I happened to engage with the "wrong" folks at the Bundestag. My host was the main opposition party, Alternative for Germany, or AfD, which made my Berlin foray unacceptable to some in Heidelberg.

title: An Age of Decision
summary: Old couples frequently experience friction over where to live and travel and how to spend money.. The title character In T.S. Eliot's "The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock" has trouble making decisions: "Do I dare to eat a peach?" He laments that "I grow old"-but at least he isn't married. Many older couples face friction over difficult decisions: where to live, where to go, what to throw out, how to spend money, what information to share.

title: OK, Fine, I'll Take Harry and Meghan's Royal Place
summary: One of the world's most famous couples turns away from the monarchy and celebrity culture. Does that mean there's an opening?. Harry and Meghan are stepping down as senior royals, or something like that. I don't know exactly how to describe it-my royalese is dodgy-but Wednesday's announcement makes it seem like they've had enough with the whole monarchy hamster wheel, and they're making a deliberate choice to walk away. A conscious unroyaling, you could call it, and probably nine bazillion people on the internet already have. Harry and Meghan say they're going to "work to be financially independent" (every parent's five favorite words), focus on their charity projects and spend more time on this side of the pond. Brilliant. I look forward to bumping into them in line at Home Depot and Chipotle.

title: Clashes Over ERA Breaking Out Once More

They only made 547 and it's a collectors' item, so I follow this auto auction site, bringatrailer.com, and go through its daily email searching for a GNX. Qassem Soleimani with a substantial attack on U.S. assets in the Middle East. It could be on the ground forces or naval resources in the area. An alternative might be to attack the resources of allies . . . Israel, Saudi Arabia, etc. Whatever Iran does, it will require a substantial retaliatory strike from the U.S.

title: The Reinterpretation of Genetic Tests Is Rare
summary: Genetics is a field of risks-not absolutes-and specific answers for a specific patient are nuanced and can be difficult.. "Gene Tests Led to Surgery, Then the Odds Changed" (Page One, Dec. 21) describes a family's experience with genetic testing, which included a rare event: a reinterpretation of genetic test results from "likely harmful" to "uncertain." It is important to emphasize that it is extremely rare that genetic testing reports change an interpretation from harmful to anything less than that. Individuals who have been told that they have a BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutation should know that it is exceedingly unlikely that anything has changed. In the rare event that the interpretation of genetic testing results change from harmful to uncertain (or vice versa), the health-care provider who ordered the test is notified. It's important for individuals who have undergone genetic testing to keep their contact information current with their health-care providers.

title: Chile's Inequality Problem Is Deeply Seated
summary: The Chilean crisis is about deep systemic inequality, the need for significant structural reforms and the widely perceived view that political and business elites are indifferent to their citizenry on these issues.. Regarding Axel Kaiser's "Latin America's 'Oasis' Descends into Chaos" (op-ed, Jan. 2): While it's true, as Mr. Kaiser says, that Chile is in a full-blown economic and political crisis, I emphatically disagree with his view that the ultimate cause of the crisis results from "a profoundly false narrative Chilean [progressive] elites tell themselves about the country . . . the myth that Chile is an extreme case of injustice and abuse." While the social-justice driven agenda and expenditures of the previous administration likely contributed to the slowdown in economic growth (along with the reduced global demand for copper), it is disingenuous to suggest that such attempts to address social needs-well designed or not-were simply the product of a false narrative.

title: Inside the Unseen Archives of Dorothea Lange
summary: Researching in the archives of Lange, the great documentarian of the Depression-era American West, artist Sam Contis uncovered a trove of unseen work by the photographer. Artist Sam Contis, whose primary medium is photography, moved to Oakland, California, from New York in 2012, settling in a neighborhood not 10 minutes by car from the photographic archive of one of her heroes, Dorothea Lange, the great documentarian of the Depression-era American West. Contis discovered this fact only belatedly, in 2017, when she visited a Lange retrospective at the Oakland Museum of California, the official repository of Lange's work since her death in 1965. Having long harbored a sense of sorority with Lange, Contis began researching there, sifting through hundreds of negatives and contact sheets, few of which had ever been printed, seen or circulated. "I was genuinely surprised at the range of work," she recalls. "This was especially true of the more personal pictures-they seemed so close to pictures I might have made."

title: The Ballad of Selena Gomez
summary: After a long journey through illness and heartbreak, the former teen star emerges as a full-fledged artist with her first album in four years.. Even before the waiter offers a menu, Selena Gomez lays her cards on the table. "I feel like I was supposed to go through everything I've gone through," she says as she takes a seat at a rooftop restaurant in Los Angeles. "I had low self-esteem, and that's something I work on continuously. But I feel so empowered because I've gained so much knowledge about what was going on mentally," she adds. Soon after, she smiles mischievously and says, "Let's talk about all the stuff I'm not supposed to." She's dressed like her 1990s style icon, Jennifer Aniston's character Rachel Green, from Friends, wearing a shrunken ribbed cardigan over a plaid sundress. "Of course, there were a few moments in my life when I felt like, Why? Why me?" she says. "But now I look at it as, At least I can relate to more people."

A magnitude-6.4 earthquake struck Puerto Rico early Tuesday, killing one person, toppling homes and buildings, and triggering a blackout on the island that is still recovering two years after Hurricane Maria.

title: Beijing Decides China Needs Real Capital Markets After All
summary: China has spent the last several years reorienting its financial system around state-owned banking. Beijing has spent the last three years stomping on its shadow banking sector. So a call by regulators over the weekend for banks and insurers to guide more household savings into capital markets with the help of "wealth management, insurance, trust and other products" should be enough to raise eyebrows. Shares in Shenzhen are up about 1% from Friday's close. The policy document promulgated Saturday could amount to a significant fillip to struggling private companies

title: NYC Harry Potter Store Might Have to Tame Its Design Dragons
summary: A landmark panel voted against what some members called 'inappropriate' signage at the Flatiron District location. Muggles of Manhattan get ready: Harry Potter is poised to work his magic in the Flatiron District, but he may have to tame his design aspirations.

title: Borden Dairy Lenders Blast 'Irrational' Bankruptcy Filing
summary: KKR's credit arm says the milk company has 'no discernible path through bankruptcy'. Lenders to Borden Dairy Co. slammed the milk producer for filing what they said was "a surprise and value-destructive bankruptcy" aimed at benefiting its private-equity backer Acon Investments.

title: America's Mideast Allies Want to Sit Out Iranian-U.S. Confrontation
summary: Countries that have long pushed for a tougher American stance toward Tehran are keeping a low profile. In the wake of the U.S. drone killing of Iranian Maj. Gen. Qassem Soleimani, America's allies in the region-nations that have long pushed for a tougher American stance on Iran-are keeping a low profile, fearing they will be hit by the fallout.

title: McConnell Says Impeachment Trial to Start Without Guarantee of Witnesses
summary: Senate majority leader rebuffs calls from Democrats to allow any more information on Trump and Ukraine. WASHINGTON-Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he has enough votes to set impeachment-trial rules that don't guarantee new witnesses would be called, rebuffing demands from Democrats amid mounting signs that a deadlock over the process was beginning to loosen.

title: Sprouts Farmers Market Names New Finance Chief
summary: Denise Paulonis previously served as CFO at Michaels. Specialty grocer Sprouts Farmers Market Inc. named a new finance chief as it looks to defend its share of the food retail industry amid growing competition from conventional supermarkets.

title: Inside Carlos Ghosn's Great Escape: A Train, Planes and a Big Black Box
summary: Resume Subscription. After months of planning and millions of dollars in costs, Carlos Ghosn climbed into a large, black case with holes drilled in the bottom. He had just traveled by train 300 miles from his court-approved Tokyo home to Osaka, Japan.

title: Biden Places His Iran Bets
summary: He comes down against the Soleimani raid and predicts Mideast chaos.. That was some speech Tuesday by Joe Biden. The Democratic presidential candidate and former Vice President wrapped himself tightly in Barack Obama's Iran policy, called Donald Trump's strike against Iranian General Qasem Soleimani a "debacle," and all but declared that Mr. Trump is the greatest single danger to world order. As election bets go, this is a big one.

title: Samsung's Profit Hurt by Chip Slump, Pins Hope on 5G
summary: As the world's largest smartphone and memory chip maker, the company's earnings are seen as a bellwether for the tech industry. SEOUL- Samsung Electronics Co. expects a 34% drop in its fourth-quarter operating profit for 2019, affected by a continued global slump in semiconductor sales that have recently clouded the company's earnings performance.

title: U.S. Troops, Allies Brace for Threatened Iranian Retaliation
summary: Commanders are shoring up defenses, moving personnel and suspending operations aimed at countering Islamic State. BEIRUT-U.S. forces and their Western allies in the Middle East took swift steps to bolster their defenses in the days before a retaliatory attack by Iran in response to last week's American drone strike that killed a top Iranian commander.

title: Oil Traders Lose Faith in Geopolitical Rallies
summary: 'If you bought any geopolitical rally last year, you were wrong,' one trader says. Escalating tensions in the Middle East are boosting oil prices, but some investors are skeptical the rally has legs after other recent geopolitical flare-ups in the market quickly eased.

title: Senator Whose Spouse Runs Major Exchange to Help Oversee Regulator
summary: Kelly Loeffler's husband Jeffrey Sprecher is chairman and chief executive of Intercontinental Exchange. A new U.S. senator whose spouse both runs and owns a minority stake in a major exchange operator will help oversee one of the company's main federal regulators, setting up a potential conflict of interest.

title: Blue State Redistribution
summary: High-tax states are losing people, money and seats in Congress.. The U.S. population grew last year at the slowest rate since World War I as the birth rate and immigration declined, the Census Bureau reported last week. Slowing population growth will have significant economic and social implications for the country, but especially for high-tax states.

title: The Oil Price That Hasn't Spiked
summary: The small move in prices shows the strategic benefit of U.S. shale.. The consequences of President Trump's targeted killing of Qasem Soleimani will play out over many months, but one notable and welcome response so far is the oil price that hasn't spiked. The U.S. shale-oil revolution is delivering benefits far beyond faster economic growth.

title: Tech Giants Defend Privacy Efforts, Promise Improvements
summary: Facebook, Apple executives at CES stand by companies' encryption, data practices amid heightened scrutiny. Privacy experts from Facebook Inc. and Apple Inc. defended the security and use of consumer data on their platforms, though they said greater protections and public education are needed, especially as technology evolves and new laws around it take shape.

title: Boeing Backs MAX Simulator Training
summary: Airlines face added complications in returning aircraft to service once regulators give go-ahead. Boeing Co. recommended extra flight-simulator training for 737 MAX pilots, a humbling and costly reversal of a longstanding design principle that helped the aircraft maker minimize the time and expense for airlines to start flying the jets.

title: Ghosn and Japan Inc. Can Make Up
summary: There is plenty of disgrace to go around, which points to a possible plea deal.. There are two reasons to become a fugitive: because you're afraid you'll get justice or afraid you won't. This column first used these words not in relation to Carlos Ghosn but in relation to Jacob "Kobi" Alexander, the tech CEO who fled to Namibia in 2006 rather than face prosecution in the stock-option backdating scandals.

title: Be Prepared for President Sanders
summary: The Vermont socialist could soon become the front-runner for the Democratic nomination.. Bernie Sanders significantly outraised his Democratic presidential rivals in the final three months of 2019. He is very much in the hunt for the first three contests of the primary season. He has run second, behind Joe Biden, in national polls for most of the past year and matches up better head-to-head against President Trump than either Elizabeth Warren or Pete Buttigieg. When Sanders supporters complain that the political press isn't giving their guy the attention he deserves, they have a point.

title: Two McDonald's Executives Allege Racial Discrimination
summary: Suit from two black executives comes as new CEO works on company culture. Two African-American executives at McDonald's Corp. sued the company alleging racial discrimination and civil rights abuses.

title: Reflections on a Turbulent Decade
summary: Students define the 2010s as a time of polarization, digitalization and backlash to globalization.. Editor's note: This Future View is about what defined the past decade. Next week we'll ask, "What's one prediction you'd make about politics, technology or education in 2020?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Jan. 14. The best responses will be published that night.

title: NBCUniversal Aims to Merge TV and Digital Ad Buying With New Tech
summary: More than 300 engineering and platform employees are working on building an all-in-one ad system. Comcast Corp. -owned NBCUniversal says it is accelerating efforts to create a single ad technology and sales infrastructure for marketers to run media plans across its TV and digital properties, and across local, national and global markets.
